Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 09:34. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Power cut reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Engineers investigating and fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power restored

UKPNIncident.PlannedIncidentReason: The reason for this work is we are replacing a piece of our electrical equipment known as a Linkbox because it is faulty. We will also be carrying out some re-inforcements works on our electricity network. Once work is completed this will reduce the possibility of you having an unplanned power cut which is why it is important to complete this work during the Coronavirus outbreak. This will also ensure our electricity network is working to the best of its ability. To ensure our engineers can carry out these works safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Please note that if your power has not gone off by approximately 10:00 then your power will remain on. The government has given exemptions to certain industries and activities, this outage falls into this category. This work is taking place in and around Devonshire Row and Cavendish Court
